abstract.t: The Remote ATtestation procedureS (RATS) architecture facilitates interoperability of attestation mechanisms by defining a set of participant roles and interactions that reveal information about the trustworthiness attributes of an attester's computing environment. By making trustworthiness attributes explicit, they can be evaluated dynamically and within an operational context where risk mitigation depends on having a more complete understanding of the possible vulnerabilities germane to the attester's environment.
